title: $9,000 in donations stolen from Catholic church in Watertown, police say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An estimated $9,000 in donations was stolen from St. Patrick's Church in Watertown on October 27.
The theft occurred sometime after 5:30 p.m. and was reported to police the following morning.
Police have released no additional details or suspect information and are seeking help from the public.

title: Bruinsâ€™ Elias Lindholm exits game with lower-body injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Elias Lindholm injured in second period collision with Sabres' Jordan Greenway, did not return to the game.
Lindholm, 30, has four power play goals and nine points in 12 games this season prior to injury.
Potential replacements include Pavel Zacha, Casey Mittelstadt, or AHL call-up Matt Poitras for top-line center role.

title: David Ortiz offers up advice to Mookie Betts amid World Series slump
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mookie Betts is struggling with a .130 batting average in the World Series as the Dodgers trail the Blue Jays 3-2.
David Ortiz advised Mookie Betts to focus on fun and leave past performance behind amid his World Series slump.
The Dodgers' offense, including stars Ohtani, Smith, and Freeman, is faltering, averaging 3.6 runs per game against Toronto.

title: Irish firefighter found guilty of raping woman in Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in prison
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Terence Crosbie, 39, an Irish firefighter, was found guilty of raping a woman in a Boston hotel and sentenced to 7-9 years in prison.
The crime occurred during a 2024 St. Patrick's Day visit; Crosbie's retrial followed a previous mistrial in June 2025.
Prosecutors cited Crosbie's dangerous mindset, referencing a 2017 tweet as evidence of his predatory behavior.

title: Brockton man allegedly in US illegally sentenced to prison for raping 14-year-old girl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Erickson Barbosa, 32, from Cape Verde, was sentenced to seven years for raping a 14-year-old girl in 2020.
Barbosa, who pleaded guilty, will also serve five years of probation and may face deportation after his sentence.
The crimes, reported in Taunton, involved multiple rapes and provision of marijuana to the victim; Barbosa fled to Florida in 2024.

title: ‘Special stuff’: Why Patriots CB Marcus Jones’s October was one to remember
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Marcus Jones signed a three-year contract extension with the New England Patriots in October 2025.
Jones was named AFC Defensive Player of the Month after a strong performance, including a key interception.
Jones excelled in special teams, highlighted by an 87-yard punt return touchdown against the Panthers.

title: Dartmouth man pleads guilty to 2024 murder of New Bedford woman
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tyler Baglini, 32, pleaded guilty to murdering Kerri Fidalgo, 31, in New Bedford in September 2024.
Baglini received a life sentence with possibility of parole in 25 years after changing his plea.
The court noted Baglini's previous charges, including assaults and an attempted air conditioning unit attack.

title: Boston police says they seized 9 more scooters as crackdown continues
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston Police Department seized nine scooters and issued seven summonses Tuesday as part of 'Operation Safe Scooter.'
Operation Safe Scooter addresses public safety concerns related to motor vehicle violations and crimes linked to scooters and mopeds.
Over 50 scooters have been seized since October as part of the crackdown, surpassing operations earlier this year.

title: Bruins defenseman, Haverhill native undergoes ankle surgery
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins defenseman Jordan Harris will miss two months after ankle surgery following an injury against the Panthers.
Haverhill native Harris underwent a successful procedure at Mass General Brigham for his right ankle fracture.
With Harris out, Providence call-ups Michael Callahan and Jonathan Aspirot may fill in for the Bruins.

title: Joe Mazzulla has expected response when asked about Celtics tanking this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics head coach Joe Mazzulla dismissed the idea of tanking, affirming commitment to winning despite an 0-3 season start.
Boston Celtics are 2-3 after defeating the Cleveland Cavaliers by 20 points, showcasing potential without Jayson Tatum.
Talk of tanking arose due to Tatum's injury and departures of key players, but Mazzulla remains focused on playoff contention.
